alert.note: Alert for Mainland Southern Brevard; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 6:09PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Brevard and northeastern Osceola Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 609 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Camp Holly Fish Camp, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Palm Bay, Melbourne, Camp Holly Fish Camp, Holopaw and West Melbourne. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
